original: Edwall, Pehr Anders Robert, domkyrkosyssloman, Växjö, f. 15/9/15 i Kalmar av sjökapt. Axel Robert E. o. Isabella Margareta Johansson. G. 41 m. gymn:dir., folkisk :lär. Maj Sjöblom. B’arn: Karin f. 42, Pehr Göran 44, Gunnar 46. — Stud :ex. i Kalmar 33, organist- o. kantorsex. där 33, teoil. fil. ex. i Lund 35, teol. kand. där 40, präst-ex. o. prästv. i Växjö 40. Past :adj. i Hinneryd 40, stiftsadj. i Växjö 41-45, fo-pastor v. fo 16 43-45, mil :past. 45, domk :sys’S’lom. o. -adj. i Växjö sed. 45. Ordf. i Växjö stifts kyrkl. bildn:förb. sed. 43, stiftsstud :ledare 41-46, ordf. i Växjö ungd:råd sed. 45 o. i Växjö kyrkl. ungd:krets sed. 46, v. ordf. i Lunds kristl. stud :förb. 37-39 o. i Kyrkl. friv:kåren i Lund 36-37, dess dirig. 33-37, sekr. i Laurentius Petri sällsk. sed. 41, Växjö stiftsråd 41-45, S :t Sigfrids stift. sed. 431, Tàl bröders hjälps stifts’komm. sed. 45, Växjö stifts teol. råd sed. 44, Växjö stifts ungd:nd 45-46 o. i Växjö stifts kyrkl. bildn:-förb. 41-45, fullm. i Växjö stifts präs- tersk. kreditkassa sed. 46, led. av styr. f. Sv res kri’stl. gymn rrör. (sydsv. avd.) 35-37, Sv:es kristl. studirör. 37-39, Sv:es kyrkl. bildn:förb. sed. 41, Riksförb. kyrkl. ungd. sed. 44, stift. Kronob. reg. soldathem sed. 45 o. av styr. f. Växjö KFUM sed. 46, led. av Kronob. reg. bildn :råd sed. 45. Skr.: Liber cantus upsaliensiis (nytryck m. inledn. 43), Liber cantus wexionensis (44), Med Bibeln i centrum (47), Enkla ord. f. skoians morgonböner (47), red. o. ansv. utg. av Växjö stifts kyrkl. mån :blad Kyrka o. Hem 41-45, musikrec. i Smålandsp0’siten -sed. 43, art. i dagspressen o. i kyrkl. tidskr. | Hobby: musik.
translated:
Edwall, Pehr Anders Robert was born on September 15, 1915 in Kalmar, to sea captain Axel Robert E. and Isabella Margareta Johansson. He married Maj Sjöblom in 1941, who was a gymnastics director and a popular educator. They had three children: Karin born in 1942, Pehr Göran born in 1944, and Gunnar born in 1946.

Edwall studied in Kalmar and received his student examination in 1933. He also obtained organist and cantor's certificates there in 1933. He received a Bachelor of Theology and Philosophy degree from Lund University in 1935, followed by a Bachelor of Theology degree in 1940. He completed his priest examination and ordination in Växjö in 1940. He served as a pastor's assistant in Hinneryd in 1940 and as a diocesan assistant in Växjö from 1941 to 1945. He was a military pastor in 1945, a cathedral treasurer and assistant in Växjö from 1945, and a responsible member of the cathedral chapter. 

Edwall was chairman of the Växjö diocesan art commission since 1943 and was a study leader from 1941 to 1946. He was also chairman of the Växjö youth council from 1945 and the Växjö church youth group from 1946. Additionally, he was vice-chairman of the Christian Study Association in Lund from 1937 to 1939, and of the Church Free Corps in Lund from 1936 to 1937, where he was also a conductor from 1933 to 1937. Furthermore, he was secretary of the Laurentius Petri Society since 1941, and was a member of the Vaxjo diocesan council from 1941 to 1945, the St. Sigfrids Diocese since 1943, the National Church's Assistance Committee since 1945, the Växjö Diocesan Theological Council since 1944, and the Växjö Diocesan Youth Commission from 1945 to 1946. Moreover, he was a full member of the Växjö priests' credit union from 1946, a member of the board of directors of the Swedish Christian Gymnastics Union (South-Sweden division) from 1935 to 1937, the Swedish Christian Student Union from 1937 to 1939, the Swedish Church Art Commission from 1941, the National Association of Church Youth from 1944, the Kronoberg Royal Crown Commission Soldiers Home in 1945, and the Växjö YMCA board of directors from 1946. He was also a member of the Crown Commission Art Council in 1945.

Edwall authored several books and publications including "Liber Cantus Upsaliensis" (1943), "Liber Cantus Wexionensis" (1944), "With the Bible in the Center" (1947), "Simple Words for School Morning Prayers" (1947), and also served as the editor and person in charge of the Växjö diocesan monthly magazine "Church and Home" from 1941 to 1945. He was also a music critic in the Småland Newspaper since 1943 and contributed articles to the daily press and church magazines. Edwall's hobby was music.

memberOf.name: Kronoberg Royal Crown Commission Soldiers Home

author.name: With the Bible in the Center
Simple Words for School Morning Prayers
